docs.text: Talking Balance This is a computer program that enables blind users to read the mass of certain scientific sets of scales (known in the lab as balances).
docs.title: Talking Balance

docs.text: This is a computer program that enables blind users to read the mass of certain scientific sets of scales (known in the lab as balances).
docs.title: Talking Balance

docs.text: About The program currently works by running on a Windows computer. The computer plugs into the scales using a serial lead, and then the program can be used to read from and control the scales to make them accessible. As the source code is written in Python, you will likely be able to download the code and run it on a Mac as well.
docs.title: About
